title: Which jobs will be immune to automation? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depending on the automation(if it is a robot doing the work or a computer doing the work) I can think about: engineers that are designing and or putting together the robotengineers that are designing and writing the code for the robot or for the computersupervisor for the jobs done automaticallyOther kinds of jobs: the ones that include taking decisions that can’t be automated, eg: lawyer, programmer, doctor, plane pilot,…creative jobs: writer, sculptor, painter…And there are many more. Of course there can be some parts of the jobs automated. The jobs can suffer transformations but will not disappear.
Analytical jobs requiring specific skill set, whilst algorithm can't do. Also servicing robots, etc. I wrote an article about it. A Consideration of Emerging Worker’s Roles In an Automated Future
